title: Kerala High Court Calls for Safer Campuses, Upholds Students' Rights
content:
The Kerala High Court has spoken out in favor of women's rights, stating that in an ideal society, women should be able to walk freely at any time of day or night. While recognizing the need for security measures, the court emphasized that discriminatory restrictions on women's movements are unacceptable. 

The court was hearing a petition filed by female students at the Kozhikode Medical College Hospital who challenged a hostel curfew.  The court ruled that while hostels should have closing times, students with valid reasons should be allowed to leave after hours. The judge acknowledged the need for societal change and improved infrastructure to make campuses and streets safer for everyone.
author: Scroll Staff
